triples.name: Microbial consortium
triples.relevance: The paper studies microbial networks and communities responding to salinity stress.

triples.name: Microbiota
triples.relevance: The paper examines abundant and rare microbiota and their roles in ecosystem stability.

triples.name: Salinity
triples.relevance: Salinity stress is the primary environmental driver studied in the paper's freshwater-to-seawater transition.

triples.name: Saltwater intrusion
triples.relevance: Seawater intrusion is identified as a major global change affecting aquatic microbiomes.

triples.name: Salinization
triples.relevance: Freshwater salinization is the process studied as an environmental stressor on microbial communities.

triples.name: Matthew effect
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates weakening of the Matthew effect in microbial communities under environmental stress.

triples.name: Microbiome
triples.relevance: The paper studies how aquatic microbiomes respond to and maintain functioning under environmental stress.

triples.name: Ecosystem service
triples.relevance: The paper discusses maintaining ecosystem functions and services in response to environmental stress.

triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: The paper shows microbial diversity significantly reduces with increasing salinity stress.

triples.name: Ecological succession
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates strong taxonomic succession in microbial communities during freshwater-to-seawater transition.

triples.name: Biogeography
triples.relevance: The paper discusses different biogeographic patterns of abundant and rare biospheres.

triples.name: Resilience (network)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes new insights on how abundant and rare biospheres maintain microbial network stability under stress.
